I came upon a post by Andrew Heiss, Working with R, Cairo graphics, custom fonts, and ggplot, and couldn‚Äôt help but notice that the featured font was one I‚Äôd seen before‚Ä¶
I thought I could forget about it‚Äî move on with my life. Maybe I could just load the tidyverse, recreate Andrew‚Äôs plot, and be done with the whole thing. library(tidyverse) # Create sample data set.seed(1234) # This makes R run the same random draw df <- data_frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100)) # Create plot p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = y)) + geom_point() + labs(title = "This is a title", subtitle = "This is a subtitle") + annotate("text", x = 0, y = 0, label = "This is some text", family = "Papyrus", color = "darkred", size = 8) + theme_light(base_family = "Comic Sans MS") p But no‚Äî that was too easy.
